name: Louvre Museum
description: The world's largest art museum in Paris

artworks.title: Mona Lisa
artworks.description: The Mona Lisa is a half-length portrait painting by Italian artist Leonardo da Vinci. Considered an archetypal masterpiece of the Italian Renaissance, it has been described as the best known, the most visited, the most written about, the most sung about, the most parodied work of art in the world.

curator_notes.note: The subject's enigmatic smile has made this painting one of the most famous works in the world.
curator_notes.author: Dr. Marie Dubois

artworks.title: Venus de Milo
artworks.description: The Venus de Milo is an ancient Greek statue and one of the most famous works of ancient Greek sculpture. Created sometime between 150 and 100 BCE, it is believed to depict Aphrodite, the Greek goddess of love and beauty.

curator_notes.note: The missing arms have sparked centuries of debate about the statue's original pose and attributes.
curator_notes.author: Dr. Classical Sculpture Expert

artworks.title: Liberty Leading the People
artworks.description: Liberty Leading the People is a painting by Eugène Delacroix commemorating the July Revolution of 1830, which toppled King Charles X of France. A woman personifying the concept and the Goddess of Liberty leads the people forward over a barricade and the bodies of the fallen, holding the flag of the French Revolution.

curator_notes.note: The painting became a symbol of the French Republic and inspired the Statue of Liberty in New York Harbor.
curator_notes.author: Dr. French Revolutionary Art
